wikipedia_page.main: Sir George Hugh Wyndham  (18 November 1836 – 10 February 1916) was a British diplomat who was minister to Serbia, Brazil and Romania.

response: *Hugh Wyndham (1836–1916), British diplomat who was minister to Serbia (1885–1888), to Brazil (1888–1894), and to Romania (1894–1897)

response: * Sir Hugh Wyndham (1602–1684), English Judge of the Common Pleas and Baron of the Exchequer
* Sir Hugh Wyndham (diplomat) (1836–1916), British diplomat, minister to Serbia, Brazil and Romania
* Hugh Wyndham, 4th Baron Leconfield (1877–1963), British peer, politician and author
Percy Charles Hugh Wyndham  (born 23 September 1864;died 6 Oct. 1943), was a senior British diplomat.Obituary. The Times (of London) Thursday, Oct 07, 1943, pg. 7

The son of Sir Hugh Wyndham, Wyndham was educated at Eton and New College, Oxford and entered the Diplomatic Service in 1890. He served at Berlin, Teheran, Constantinople, Madrid, Washington, D.C., Caracas, Brussels and Rome.He was  Minister Plenipotentiary to the Republic of Colombia from 1911 to 1918.‘WYNDHAM, Sir Percy’, Who Was Who, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 1920–2016; online edn, Oxford University Press, 2014 ; online edn, April 2014 accessed 24 Oct 2017
